1   package com.anthavio.httl.cache;
2   
3   import java.util.Map;
4   import java.util.Map.Entry;
5   import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
6   import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
7   
8   import org.slf4j.Logger;
9   import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
10  
11  /**
12   * 
13   * @author martin.vanek
14   *
15   */
16  public class HeapMapRequestCache<V> extends RequestCache<V> {
17  
18  	private final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(getClass());
19  
20  	private TtlEvictingThread ttlEvictingThread;
21  
22  	private Map<String, CacheEntry<V>> storage = new ConcurrentHashMap<String, CacheEntry<V>>();
23  
24  	public HeapMapRequestCache() {
25  		this(0, null);
26  	}
27  
28  	public HeapMapRequestCache(int evictionInterval, TimeUnit evictionUnit) {
29  		super("SIMPLE");
30  		if (evictionInterval > 0) {
31  			ttlEvictingThread = new TtlEvictingThread(evictionInterval, evictionUnit);
32  			ttlEvictingThread.start();
33  		}
34  	}
35  
36  	@Override
37  	protected CacheEntry<V> doGet(String key) {
38  		CacheEntry<V> entry = this.storage.get(key);
39  		if (entry == null) {
40  			return null;
41  		} else if (entry.getHardExpire() < System.currentTimeMillis()) {
42  			//silly but true - don't return if it's expired
43  			storage.remove(key);
44  			return null;
45  		} else {
46  			return entry;
47  		}
48  	}
49  
50  	@Override
51  	protected Boolean doSet(String key, CacheEntry<V> entry) {
52  		this.storage.put(key, entry);
53  		return true;
54  	}
55  
56  	@Override
57  	public Boolean doRemove(String key) {
58  		CacheEntry<V> entry = this.storage.remove(key);
59  		return entry != null ? Boolean.TRUE : Boolean.FALSE;
60  	}
61  
62  	@Override
63  	public void removeAll() {
64  		logger.debug("Cache clear");
65  		this.storage.clear();
66  	}
67  
68  	@Override
69  	public void close() {
70  		logger.debug("Cache destroy");
71  		if (ttlEvictingThread != null) {
72  			ttlEvictingThread.keepGoing = false;
73  			ttlEvictingThread.interrupt();
74  		}
75  	}
76  
77  	private class TtlEvictingThread extends Thread {
78  
79  		private final long interval;
80  
81  		private boolean keepGoing = true;
82  
83  		public TtlEvictingThread(int interval, TimeUnit unit) {
84  			this.interval = unit.toMillis(interval);
85  			if (this.interval < 1000) {
86  				throw new IllegalArgumentException("Interval " + this.interval + " must be >= 1000 millis");
87  			}
88  			this.setName(HeapMapRequestCache.this.getName() + "-reaper");
89  			this.setDaemon(true);
90  		}
91  
92  		@Override
93  		public void run() {
94  			while (keepGoing) {
95  				try {
96  					Thread.sleep(interval);
97  				} catch (InterruptedException ix) {
98  					if (keepGoing) {
99  						logger.debug("TtlEvictingThread stopped from sleep");
100 						return;
101 					} else {
102 						logger.warn("TtlEvictingThread interrupted but continue");
103 					}
104 				}
105 				doEviction();
106 			}
107 			logger.debug("TtlEvictingThread stopped from work");
108 		}
109 
110 		private void doEviction() {
111 			long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
112 			try {
113 				//XXX beware of concurrent changes of storage
114 				for (Entry<String, CacheEntry<V>> entry : storage.entrySet()) {
115 					if (entry.getValue().getHardExpire() < now) {
116 						storage.remove(entry.getKey());
117 					}
118 				}
119 			} catch (Exception x) {
120 				logger.warn("Exception during eviction", x);
121 			}
122 		}
123 	}
124 
125 }
